intro: Seymeria tenuifolia, commonly known as the slender leaf seymaria, is a member of the family Apiaceae, characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in moist, shady environments, often found in temperate regions. The plant produces small, white flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. Its leaves are thin and elongated, giving it a delicate appearance. Seymeria tenuifolia is valued in horticulture for its ornamental foliage and ability to thrive in woodland gardens.
